div.head: THE CONTENTES OF ALL THE HOLY SCRIPTVRE aswell of the olde testament as of the newe.
div.p: Deut .vi .i. Tymothe .ii Gen .xvii. Exod .xv. Gene .i. Psa .x. Exod .iii. Ierem .ix. Roma .ix. Esa .liiii. Hiere .x. Gene .i. Sapi .ii. Roma .v. Fyrst the holy writinges of the Bible teach vs / that there is one God, almyghtye, that hath neither begynnynge ne endynge:God. which of his owne goodnes dyd create all thynges: of whome all thinges procede, & withoute whom is nothyng: which is ryghtous and mercyfull, and which worketh al thynges in all after his wyl: of whom it may not be demaunded wherfore he doth this or that.

❧ Then that this very God did create Adam the first man after his owne Image and lykenes,Creacion of man. and dyd ordeyne and appoynte hym Lorde of all creatures in erth, Which Adam by the enuy of the deuill, disobeyinge the commaundement of his maker, did first sinne, and brought sin into this worlde,Ephe .ii. such and so greate, that we which be spronge of him after the flesshe, are subdued vnto sinne, deathe, and damnacion, broughte vnder the yoke and tyranny of the deuyll.

Gene .iii.xii.xxvi.xxviii. • bre .ii.❧ And further,Chryst promysed. yt Chryst Iesus his son was promised of God the father, to be a sauouyre to this Adam, Abraham, Isaac, Iacob, Dauid, and the other fathers: whiche shulde delyuer them frome their synnes and tyrannye of the deuyll, whervnto they were all subiect by Adam.

• xodi .xix.xx.❧ And that in the meane seasō whyle the fathers loked for saluacion and delyueraunce promysed, because mans nature is such,Law. that he not onely can not, but also wyl not confesse hym selfe to be a synner, and specyally such a synner as hath nede of the sauinge health promysed,Rom .iii. Gala .iii .i. Cori .i. the lawe was giuen throughe whiche men myghte knowe sinne, and that they are sinners when they se they do none of the thinges that the law commaundeth, with so glad and wyllynge a minde as God requireth: but rather agaynste their wylles, without affection, and as though they were constrayned with the feare of that hell which the lawe threatneth sayinge: Curssed be he that mayntayneth not all the wordes of this lawe to kepe them. And that this lawe was gyuen to thintente that synne and the malyce of mens hert beinge therby the better knowen, men shuld the more feruentl thryst the commynge of Christe, whiche shulde redeme them from their synnes.

Luke. • i. Galathi .iiii. Eph .i. Roma .v. Tit .iii.❧ Last of all: we are taughte / that that Chryste whiche was promysed and shadowed in the olde testament, is sent of the father,Chryste the sauyour cōmeth. at suche tyme as he had determyned with hym selfe, at suche tyme (I saye) as all wyckednesse florysshed. And that he was sēt not for any mans good workes (for they all were synners) but to thintente he wolde make good his promise and shewe the aboundant riches of his grace, whiche he had promysed.

Iohn .i. Esaye .iiii .i. Io .ii. Luc .i. Rom .v. Ioh .iii. • .vi.❧ In the newe testament therfore it is moste euidently declared, that Iesus Chryst the true lambe and hooste,The lambe the sacrifice. is come to reconcyle vs to the father, payinge on the crosse the punyshmente due to oure synnes: and to delyuer vs from the bondage of the deuyll (vnto whom we serued through sinne) and to make vs the sonnes of God,Peax. sith he hath gyuē vs the true peax
and tranquilitie of conscience, that we no longer do feare the paynes of hell: which feare is put away by the fayth,Fayth. that the father giueth, vs drawyng vs vnto his sonne.i. Timoth. •
For that faith is the gyft of God wherby we beleue yt Christe is come in to this worlde to saue sinners: which is of so greate pith that they whiche haue it, desyre to perfourme al the dutyes of loue to al men, after the example of Chryst. For faythe ones receyued, God gyueth his holye ghost,ii. Cor .i. & v. Ephe .i. Roma .viii .i. Cor .iiii. Gala .v .ii. Cor .v. wherwith he tokeneth and marcketh all that beleue:The holye ghost. which is the pledge and earnest that we shall surelye possesse euerlastyng lyfe, and that gyueth witnes vnto oure spirite, and grafteth this faith in vs, that we be the sonnes of God pourynge therwith the loue in to oure hertes which Paul descrybeth and setteth out to the Corinthians.Loue. By that faith and confydence in Christe whiche by loue is myghty in operacion, and that sheweth it selfe thorow the workes of loue sterynge men therto,Iustyce. by that (I say) we are iustyfyed: that is, by that fayth, Chrystes father (whiche is become oures also thorowe that Christ our brother) counteth vs for ryghtous & for his sonnes: imputing not our sinnes vnto vs thorowe his grace.

To conclude, he came that we being clensed from our synnes,Tit .ii. Luc .i. Ephe .ii .ii. Pe .i. & sanctifyed vnto God the father: that is, halowed vnto the vse of the father to exercyse good workes forsaking the workes of the flesh shuld frely serue him in rightousnes and holynesse al our life long thorow good workes which God hath ordeyned that we shuld walke in them declaring our selues therby to be surely called vnto this grace:Workes. which workes whosoeuer hath not, declareth yt he hath not fayth in Chryst.

The last iudgement.❧ This is that Chryst Iesus whiche after he hath kylled the man of synne with the breath of his mouth,ii. Thess .ii .ii. Cor .v. Math .xv. shal syt in his maiesty and iudge al men, geuing vnto euery one the workes of his body, accordinge to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad. And that shal say vnto them that shal be on his right hande. Come ye blessed children of my father, inherete ye the kyngdome prepared for you from the begynning of the world: And vnto thē that shall be on his lefte hande. Depart from me ye curssed,i Corinta. •
into euerlastynge fyre: which is prepared for the deuyll and his aungels. Then shall the ende come and he shall delyuer vp the kyngdome to God the father.

Lyfe euerlastynge.❧ To thintent we shulde knowe this / by the goodnes of God workynge by his holy spirite, are the holy writinges of the Byble gyuen vs:ii. Pe .i. Iohn .xix. Iohn .xx. That we shulde knowe (I saye) and beleue that there is one God, and Iesus Christe whome he hath sent: and that in beleuyng we shuld haue euerlasting lyfe thorow his name.

❧ An other foundacion then this can no mā lay.i Cor .iii. And S. Paul desyreth that he be holdē a curssed which preacheth any other faith & saluacion, then only by Iesus Christ: though it were an angel of heuen.Gala .i. Roma .xi. For of him, and thorow him, & for him, are al thinges: to whom, with the father and the holy ghoste, be honour and glory for euer more. AMEN.
